channel.title: Need help!
channel.description: what is the command for spawning npc? and how do i make my own commands? If you could answer that would be great thanks

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @subtle_end2 subtle end2
item.description:
@subtle_end2 wrote:

Well, thanks guys that was very helpful.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“dog eats dog, post:5, topic:155186”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=211881.msg1852638#msg1852638 date=1193622305]

for spawning an npc it goes like this
::npc (npcid)
And you need a command generator or unless you make from scratch lol

What, a batch file that echos “What is the name of your command???” that you all call generators?
[/quote]

Ahh yes, thats why my CG is :

:Commandgenerator
cls
Title Welcome to Dog eats Dog command Generator
Set /p CmdName=Command Name:?
Set /p RUSure=Are you possitive you want %CmdName% as the name?(yes,no)?
If %RUSure%==no GOTO Star
If not Exist CommandsFolder MD Commands Folder
Echo else if(command.equalsignorecase("%CmdName%")) >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Echo { >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
cls
set /p AY=Add items to be Spawned when Input Command(yes,no)?
If %AY%==YES Goto addItem
If %AY%==yes Goto addItem
If %AY%==no Goto endCode
If %AY%==NO Goto endCode
:addItem
cls
set /p ID=What is the ID of the Wepon/Armor/Thing you have chosen?
cls
set /p Amount=How much of that Item would you like??
cls
echo     addItem(%ID%,%Amount%); >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Set /P AT=Add item, add tele or finish command.(AI = Add item ,T = tele , End)
If %AT%==ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==Ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==AI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==aI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==T GOTO Tele
If %AT%==t GOTO Tele
If %AT%==end GOTO endCode
If %AT%==END GOTO endCode
If %AT%==EnD GOTO endCode
If %AT%==eNd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==ENd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==enD GOTO endCode
if %AT%==End Goto endcode
if %type%==* goto error
echo.
goto error
:error
cls
echo Commands invalid. Only use commands from the menu.
pause
goto menu
:endCode
cls
Echo } >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Set /p Again=would you like to make AnotherMake Another (yes, No)?
If %Again%==yes GOTO Star
If %Again%==no goto fin
If %Again%==YES GOTO Star
If %Again%==NO goto fin
:Tele
cls
Set /P X=What is the XCoord?
Set /P Y=What is the YCoord?
Echo teleportToX = %X% >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Echo teleportToY = %Y% >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Set /P AT=addItem Or Another Tele(not Used In Same Command Usually(AI,T,End)
If %AT%==ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==Ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==AI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==aI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==T GOTO Tele
If %AT%==t GOTO Tele
If %AT%==end GOTO endCode
If %AT%==END GOTO endCode
If %AT%==EnD GOTO endCode
If %AT%==eNd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==ENd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==enD GOTO endCode
if %AT%==End Goto endcode

:fin
echo You have Succesfully Created a command.
pause
cls
goto main

That big, Right? That prints out one sentence? No, It makes a command.[/quote]
And just, what would you do if your on Linux?
l2crossplatform.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help!
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:4, topic:155186”][quote author=rs w00dcut link=topic=211881.msg1852630#msg1852630 date=1193622124]
for spawning an npc it goes like this
::npc (npcid)
And you need a command generator or unless you make from scratch lol
[/quote]
What, a batch file that echos “What is the name of your command???” that you all call generators?[/quote]

Ahh yes, thats why my CG is :

:Commandgenerator
cls
Title Welcome to Dog eats Dog command Generator
Set /p CmdName=Command Name:?
Set /p RUSure=Are you possitive you want %CmdName% as the name?(yes,no)?
If %RUSure%==no GOTO Star
If not Exist CommandsFolder MD Commands Folder
Echo else if(command.equalsignorecase("%CmdName%")) >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Echo { >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
cls
set /p AY=Add items to be Spawned when Input Command(yes,no)?
If %AY%==YES Goto addItem
If %AY%==yes Goto addItem
If %AY%==no Goto endCode
If %AY%==NO Goto endCode
:addItem
cls
set /p ID=What is the ID of the Wepon/Armor/Thing you have chosen?
cls
set /p Amount=How much of that Item would you like??
cls
echo     addItem(%ID%,%Amount%); >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Set /P AT=Add item, add tele or finish command.(AI = Add item ,T = tele , End)
If %AT%==ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==Ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==AI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==aI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==T GOTO Tele
If %AT%==t GOTO Tele
If %AT%==end GOTO endCode
If %AT%==END GOTO endCode
If %AT%==EnD GOTO endCode
If %AT%==eNd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==ENd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==enD GOTO endCode
if %AT%==End Goto endcode
if %type%==* goto error
echo.
goto error
:error
cls
echo Commands invalid. Only use commands from the menu.
pause
goto menu
:endCode
cls
Echo } >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Set /p Again=would you like to make AnotherMake Another (yes, No)?
If %Again%==yes GOTO Star
If %Again%==no goto fin
If %Again%==YES GOTO Star
If %Again%==NO goto fin
:Tele
cls
Set /P X=What is the XCoord?
Set /P Y=What is the YCoord?
Echo teleportToX = %X% >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Echo teleportToY = %Y% >> ".\Commands\%CmdName% Command.txt"
Set /P AT=addItem Or Another Tele(not Used In Same Command Usually(AI,T,End)
If %AT%==ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==Ai GOTO addItem
If %AT%==AI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==aI GOTO addItem
If %AT%==T GOTO Tele
If %AT%==t GOTO Tele
If %AT%==end GOTO endCode
If %AT%==END GOTO endCode
If %AT%==EnD GOTO endCode
If %AT%==eNd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==ENd GOTO endCode
If %AT%==enD GOTO endCode
if %AT%==End Goto endcode

:fin
echo You have Succesfully Created a command.
pause
cls
goto main

That big, Right? That prints out one sentence? No, It makes a command.
